In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can implement the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    return result * line
end
```

This function splits the input string into words, then iterates over each word. If adding a new word to the current line would exceed `text_width`, it appends the current line to the result and starts a new line. It continues this until all words have been processed. 

Here's an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
println(wrap_string(str))
```

This will print:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit 
amet, consectetur adipiscing 
elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor 
incididunt ut labore et 
dolore magna aliqua.
```
